On 10/31/05, Elliotte Harold <elharo@...> wrote:

>

n't see a use for a door now, why do you expect you'll find one

=
I don't, but others might.  And they often do.

And I have sometimes be on =
the receiving end of such a feature:  using a
protected method of a library=
 that just happened to be there, then notified
the author of the library I =
was using it this way, and he said "I had never
thought of that, that's pre=
tty cool, I'm going to make this hook officially
supported from now on".

Y=
ou seem to be putting the cart before the horse. I design APIs
> to fit the=
 use cases, not hypothesize use cases to justify an API.


In that case, ch=
ances are pretty good that a lot people gave up on your
libraries and you n=
ever knew because they never bothered to let you know.
And it's also likely=
 that you considerably restricted the reach of your work
by artificially re=
stricting it like this.
